intro: Peltactila hispida, commonly known as the hispid peltate, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive peltate leaves, which have a broad, shield-like shape with a central stalk. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in warm, humid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
